abstract: Brooklyn Community Services, one of eight organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Lavelle Lockett rebuild his life after years of homelessness and schizophrenia diagnosis.

keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Lavelle Lockett, 26, had been homeless when he was hospitalized at a psychiatric center. Two years later, he has an apartment and hopes to attend college.
snippet: Lavelle Lockett, 26, had been homeless when he was hospitalized at a psychiatric center. Two years later, he has an apartment and hopes to attend college....

headline.main: After Schizophrenia Diagnosis, a Sense of Clarity and a Place of His Own
headline.print_headline: After Schizophrenia Diagnosis, Finding Clarity and a Place of His Own
